articles.title: Hampton Roads Regional inmate's estate sues jail, alleging wrongful death
articles.description: NORFOLK — The estate of an inmate who died at Hampton Roads Regional Jail has filed a lawsuit seeking $13.85 million in damages, alleging negligence, deprivation of rights and wrongful death.

articles.author: By PATRICK WILSON Richmond Times-Dispatch
articles.title: Cases closed by state jail death investigator aren't public
articles.description: RICHMOND, Va. (AP) — A new state jail death investigator reviewing cases back to July 1 has closed 17 while 36 remain pending, including the death of an 18-year-old on May 15 in the Hampton Roads Regional Jail.

articles.title: He sexually abused a minor — and looked for a hit man to kill the girl, Virginia cops say
articles.description: Police allege that Antwann Miller, a 36-year-old from Portsmouth, Virginia, sexually abused a child under the age of 16 — and then twice tried to hire a hit man to kill the minor while he was in jail for the crime.

articles.author: By K. BURNELL EVANS Richmond Times-Dispatch
articles.title: Virginia jail investigator, policy analyst envisioned in reform bill started work this week
articles.description: A Virginia Department of Corrections employee picked to boost oversight of Virginia’s local and regional jails in the wake of high-profile deaths said Wednesday that his reviews of critical incidents will also look “for what’s being done right.”

articles.author: BY K. BURNELL EVANS Richmond Times-Dispatch
articles.title: Virginia Board of Corrections has yet to begin reviewing jail deaths, 109 days after it became law
articles.description: Although 109 days have passed since the state Board of Corrections became legally responsible for overseeing jail death investigations, the newly reconstituted board has yet to launch a single probe.
